userreviews.userReview: Another fun ride with Merry Wrath, her cats, her girl scout troop, her boyfriend the local cop Rex, her former CIA handler Riley and the whole supporting cast. A series that should be read in published order. Poor Merry, her former CIA life just will not leave her alone.

What an exciting story! As usual, this author came up aces once again. I absolutely love Merry, Rex and Riley, and we can't forget the cats, Philby (aka Hitler-doppelganger) and Martini! Merry has to be the funniest ex-CIA agent I have ever read about and she is so great with her young Girl Scout troop. I think I could read a book a day in this series and never tire of it. Keep up the great work!!!I voluntarily reviewed an Advanced Reader Copy of this book.

Oh my talk about laugh, everytime I start a Merry Wrath mystery I think her life just can't get more funny but then it does, her girl scout troop always adds a great dose of humor and yes there are more dead bodies piling around Merry but it's really not her fault she is RETIRED yes RETIRED CIA lol...

What makes the Merry Wrath series a great read isn't the main character, but the supporting characters and animals. The most hilarious scenes in the book involved either the cats (trying to feed Philby her medicine was glorious) or the Girl Scouts (the laser range against the Boy Scouts was great, but so were the speeches at the beginning of the mud run). This book also made some headway in the love triangle. Though love triangles can add some suspense to the sexual tension between two characters, I am rather wary of them, because of two series. One is Stephanie Plum (Janet Evanovich), which I stopped reading after book 20, because I just couldn't take it anymore. Just resolve the damn thing, give them a split personality and have Ranger and Morelli be the same person for all I care. The second one is Kathleen Turner (Tiffany Snow). In this series it was obvious that she was going to end up with Kade, as he needed her more (which incidentally is also why Blaine let her go). It wasn't just the unnecessary drama that ruined this love triangle, but reading how 10 years later Blaine was still pining for her, never allowed himself to move on and was absolutely miserable. The only person completely oblivious to the fact that Riley still had feelings for her is Merry. After the reveal that he never cheated on her in the last book, she is conflicted about her own emotions, to say the least (lack of closure). Having Rex propose to Merry in this book and Kelly (as well as Maria) telling her that Riley was going to as well, doesn't bode well for the series.The weakest part was actually the case itself. The problem wasn't so much the conclusion, but the fact that Riley had to make a series of dumb mistakes to kick of this chain of events. Starting with writing a book about Merry's career and including some very sensitive information. Are we to believe that he was so hung up on Merry that he wrote a book, in which he gave their relationship a happy ending? And using a Hollywood movie to expose state secrets? Even if the intro says that this movie was based on a true story, nobody would take it seriously, because movies are supposed to be entertaining not accurate. That part didn't work for me at all. The revelation how they kept tabs on Merry in the end was great fun again.Overall I would give this 3,5 stars. Great fun, but mediocre plot.

When Finnoughla Merrygold Czrygy was outed by the vice president, she had to leave the CIA. Her cover was blown, so she settled in Who's There, Iowa and took her mother's maiden name, becoming Merry Wrath. Since that time, trouble has found her as if she never left the Agency. So it was with extreme delight that she found the pizza guy murdered in his car across the street where her boyfriend (a police detective) lives. Not. Her. House. Or. Problem. Of course the celebration was short lived, because of course everything suspicious connects up with Merry!In a moment of loneliness Merry decides to go to a movie and happens on one called Spy Diary. Partway through the film she realises that every move, every case made by the star is a move or case from her own past history. When the movie is stopped abruptly and pulled from theaters nationwide, she has the inkling she is in trouble. Does the Agency think she wrote this movie? In a heartbeat she is calling in favors trying to find out what has happened.Meanwhile the scout troup signs up for a mud run course, and decides to challenge a boy scout team with a laser game at the mall. Intending to use it as a bonding experience prior to the mud run, Merry agrees to the plan. Only when they get there it is her 3rd grade troup against 15 and 16 year old boys. With the assistance of Dr. Body (yes, the coroner's actual name) they have a plan...I have a plan too! It is to reread ALL of this series as soon as possible because I LOVED this book so much. I laughed until my eyes watered. I laughed at the cats and their escapades. I laughed at Merry. I laughed at the girl scouts. I laughed at Dr. Body. I even laughed at baby Finn. Ah...got to love a book and author that leaves you feeling so good! Don't miss this book!! And if you are new to the series (WHERE HAVE YOU BEEN???) you need to start at the beginning and read them all in order. L.L. you are the best! Can't wait to see what happens next, especially with R.

When I finished Book 4 in this series, I had to buy this one. (The first chapter included in the back of that book intrigued me so much, I had to find out what happened next. Good marketing ploy. LOL) I've become addicted to Merry Wrath's adventures. Or should I say misadventures? This one starts with a more serious situation--Merry goes to the movies and sees her CIA career splashed across the screen. Holy smoke! Even though she didn't leak any classified info, her former employer thinks she did. The two people in the agency she trusts won't return her calls. That's scary enough. A dead guy in her bedroom adds to her worries. But all that isn't enough to take her mind off the Mud Run her troop enters. Who can resist the prize of an all-paid trip to the best camp in the Girl Scout Council?As always in this series, the characters are the best part. The girls in Merry & Kelly's troop steal the show. They are smarter and cleverer than eight-year-olds should be. A new parent, Kelly has gotten stricter in her insistence on fair play and no cheating. Merry's boyfriend Rex wants to up their relationship. And her former CIA handler (and best friend) has grown weirder. A few good surprises and twists add to the enjoyment of this book. Is it the end of the Merry Wrath series? I hope not. (Right now, my book budget can take a breather.)

Laugh out loud mystery that grabs you when you start! Can't wait for the next one!This series just keeps getting funnier and funnier! Trouble always seems to find Merry Wrath a retired CIA agent who is hiding out in Who's There, Iowa. Dead bodies seem to find her anyway. With the help of her former handler, Riley and her boyfriend, a policeman in town, Rex, she has always managed to catch the murderers. This time is different since she goes alone to a movie and sees her classified life splayed out on the screen. Who could have know all this and leaked all this secret classified material and why are there dead bodies showing up in her boyfriend's driveway and in her own house. Can she trust anyone in the CIA and why do they think she is the leak, are they coming after her? And can Rex help her since he is on the case? And her girl scout troup, can they win the Mud Run these little girls with incredibly sneaky minds? So much fun, mystery and laugh out loud humor throughout will keep you from putting this one down once you start reading!

Merry goes to a movie after a dead body appears in Rex driveway for a change. To her total surprise and angst, her career as a CIA agent is being played out on the screen. Which can possibly get her significant prison time as her career is still classified. With another murder Merry and one of her cats being kidnapped, and the girl scout troupe using some very clever maneuvers to win an obstacle course in which Merry is still being attacked. Meanwhile Merry has to decide what she wants for her life as far as moving her relationship with Rex to the next level, or deciding what she wants for or with Riley. Leslie wrote a fun story that has lots of action and humor in it. In my opinion it was the weakest of the stories in that several procedural protocols for investigating were either not followed, or flat out broken. There are hints for the next book that will bring back a very lively character from a previous story, and promises to be very entertaining.

Hail, Hail the Gangs All Here!! The Merry Wrath books are always tons of fun & highly addicting. In Mud Run Murder Merry is back in another action packed, laugh filled adventure. This time Merry has to deal with the dead bodies that keep piling up both human & animal, her current boyfriend Rex wanting to take their relationship to the next level, old boyfriend/handler Riley's betrayal, & competing in a mud run with her 3rd grade group of Girl Scouts. As the plot thickens & becomes more entangled I couldn't stop laughing at some of the bizarre situations Merry gets herself into, especially her first babysitting job with goddaughter Finn - the cats & diapers are to die for! Her Girl Scout pack is so diabolical! Definitely future operatives in the making. This is a must read for all Merry Wrath fans!

Sigh. I was looking forward to this one. Unfortunately, it didn't meet my high hopes. The case was very confusing and not very thought out. I also felt like it felt the passion of earlier cases.Merry once again suspected Riley of wrongdoing, something she does in almost every book, only to be proven wrong. Added to that her continued denial of figuring out her feelings for him, instead fleeing into her boring relationship with Rex, whose proposal she accepts. There is no other scene with Riley after that, so we're kept hanging.Also, it turns out one beloved character is a traitor. Do we get a closure on any of this? No.So yeah, I'm disappointed. And hope she gets back to her wits in the next one - and ends this love triangle. Of course in Riley's favor.

Mud Run Murder was another excellent and highly enjoyable entry in the Merry Wrath Murders. This retired CIA agent Merry Wrath is caught up in a Murder as her past as spy splashes across the silver screen as the subject of a new movie, one she had nothing to do with, although that fact isn't going to stop the CIA turning up in Where's That to cause all sorts of problems for Merry & Rex. On top of all of that the girls are off to a Mud Run Competiton, Kelly is at a family reunion, Philby has found a mouse infestation and Rex may or may not be in town. Thoroughly enjoyed this latest Merry Wrath Murder and I look forward to the next onel

Merry Wrath is up to her eyeballs in mud and murder. On a rare trip to the movies alone Merry checks out a film called spy diary and sees her entire CIA career on screen involving classified cases. The CIA thinks she is behind the leak and she scrambles to find out who is trying to frame her. Meanwhile, Riley is MIA, Rex wants to take things to the next level and her scout troop looks to beat the nasty boy scouts in the mud run while trying to stay a few steps ahead of the bad dudes. Another fantastic bit of fun story-telling by Ms. Langtry. Please, Leslie, write more!

Mud run murwMerry Wrath,an her merry band of Girl Scouts are back for another round of mayhem.One night,Merry goes to the movies alone and finds herself watching a movie about her CIA missions.Then there's some unexplained murders,a cutthroat laser tag game between her scouts and an older boy scout team.Her exhandler,Riley is sulking around town. Merry finds someone trying to enter her house,she proceeds to shoot up her guest room.Her police boyfriend,Rex,moves her into his house.This book is a fun read and I look forward to the next installment.

Merry is no longer a CIA agent so it's R&R time, right? Not! Instead she gets some RR&R, lol. Rex, Riley & the surprise involvement of R's. I declare she seems to be a murder magnet even without being in the spy business. The Mud Run & those girl scouts antics are hilarious!!! In the end the mystery is solved....the life and love of Merry is a whole other mystery which I enjoy reading and anxiously look forward to what she decides to do next.

Another hitI absolutely love this series . I would like to know where Mrs. Langtry comes up with her ideas. This is just awesome series that is ' very enjoyable. Merry has to have the worst luck that always a riot. Not only is she trying to help her troop win a mud run, but she is trying to figure out how she is involved in movie and which man does she want to be with.Great book and looking forward to the next one.

I absolutely adore the Merry Wrath character. She has so many great characteristics, she just can help getting caught up in finding the latest dead body. Her boyfriend, circle of friends and girl scout troop always get tangled right in with her. These stories have great plots and and will make you laugh out loud in places. You will have to get the entire series!

IncredibleOh my gosh. I haven't laughed so hard in a long time Between the laser tag and the comments from Betty I was in tears from laughing. The twists in this one were riveting. Some I was not too pleased about. I loved this one so much. I am excited to see what the future holds for Merry.

I love this series and this book is a great addition. The story is fun and entertaining, the characters are a little zany and likable; elements that make up a great story. I can't wait to read what happens next. I received a copy of this book from the publisher, my review has been voluntarily submitted.

Love this series. CIA agent turned girl scout troop leader has more difficulty keeping her 9yo girls in line than she did her CIA targets. Leslie Langtry has turned this series into one of my favorites. Great laughs, precocious 9 year olds, cutie pie boyfriend and a stressed-out, new-mom best friend. Fun read!

This one has a lot of good twist & turns to it! Merry & her girls scouts are totally a bunch, you have to love them. Wow to make a decision REX or RILEY. Can't wait to see what adventure Merry has in store for us next.

Mud runs and possible RussiansOH BOY! Poor Merry has ended up in a load of trouble this time and for once it isn't her fault. Handlers and friends can be a whole lot more trouble than they're worth. Cats on the other hand are pretty spot on.

I love the Merry Wrath series, and this newest addition is just as great as the rest. With twists and turns throughout, it'll keep you guessing until the end. I highly recommend it for those who enjoy cozy mysteries.

i think this is my third from this series now. they are always enjoyable and a bit out of the ordinary for the what caused the bad guy to do bad things. merry is great, but the girl scouts are my favorite.

Can not wait until the next one Love those girl scouts , twist on who the mastermind was in this one trying not to give anything away. But one of my favorite of the series and can not wait to find out about Riley The next one
Great readAs always a fun read. Great dialogue, suspense, action and just plain laugh out loud funny . Can’t wait till get started reading the next installment
Mud Run Murder is yet another laugh out loud, fun to read Merry Wrath mystery from Leslie Langtry! Recommended!
Love this series! A quick, fun read that'll keep you laughing. Keep them coming! Oh, and I'm still Team Riley!
3.5 stars. This is a fun series where I laugh and shake my head at the antics poor Merry finds herself in with her past and her wonderful third grade Girl Scout troop.
Another cracker for Merry. I am solely Team Riley though, I enjoyed the mud run but didn't particularly love the Maria element. Any time we focus on the Girl Scouts its a hoot!
Another fun adventure with Merry Wrath and her Girl Scouts. Further developments in the love triangle make me anxious to read the next book!

description: From USA Today bestselling author, Leslie Langtry comes the next laugh-out-loud Merry Wrath Mystery...Ex-CIA Agent turned small town Girl Scout leader, Merry Wrath, thinks she has her hands full getting her troop ready for the Mud Run out at scout camp. But a trip to the movies, where she sees her whole career played out on the big screen, turns her world from little girls to great big lies. Turns out her former handler, Riley, is hiding something and the Agency is on the warpath, thinking Merry has leaked classified intel.From a bizarre organization called Coats for Cats to redecorating her guest room with bullet holes, her life is turning into a Merry-go-round of misdirection, miscreants and misdemeanors. Can she clear her name, or will the Mud Run turn into a run for her life?Merry Wrath Mysteries:Merit Badge Murder – book #1Mint Cookie Murder – book #2Scout Camp Mystery – short story in the "Killer Beach Reads" collectionMarshmallow S'More Murder – book #3Movie Night Murder – book #4Mud Run Murder – book #5Fishing Badge Murder – short story in the "Pushing Up Daisies" collectionMotto for Murder – book #6What critics are saying about Leslie Langtry's books:"I laughed so hard I cried on multiple occasions while reading MARSHMALLOW S'MORE MURDER! Girl Scouts, the CIA, and the Yakuza... what could possibly go wrong?"~ Fresh Fiction"Darkly funny and wildly over the top, this mystery answers the burning question, 'Do assassin skills and Girl Scout merit badges mix…"~ RT BOOKreviews"Mixing a deadly sense of humor and plenty of sexy sizzle, Leslie Langtry creates a brilliantly original, laughter-rich mix of contemporary romance and suspense."~ Chicago Tribune"Langtry gets the fun started from page one with a myriad of clever details."~ Publisher's Weekly
